summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 regarding discovery issues in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. Defense attorney Laura Menninger details numerous technical problems with accessing and reviewing photo evidence provided by the prosecution, including corrupt files, missing metadata, and difficulties viewing images designated as 'highly confidential' containing adult nudity. She requests copies of hard drives and challenges the burden of reviewing adult material only in government offices.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who writes a detailed email to the prosecution outlining critical problems with the discovery provided, including unreadable photos, corrupt spreadsheets, and issues with accessing 'highly confidential' material.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of Laura Menninger, incarcerated at MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center), who is unable to review discovery due to technical problems with the files provided on her laptop.

connections.description: Laura Menninger is the defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case, as evidenced by her advocacy regarding discovery issues on Maxwell's behalf.

events.title: Discovery Review Discussion
events.description: A discussion occurred between the defense and prosecution regarding photo evidence, referenced as happening the prior Thursday.

events.title: Defense Email on Discovery Deficiencies
events.description: Laura Menninger sends a detailed email to the prosecution outlining numerous critical problems with the discovery provided, including corrupt files, unreadable photos, and issues with 'highly confidential' designations.

events.title: Prosecution Forward of Defense Concerns
events.description: A prosecutor forwards Laura Menninger's email to another party, noting the defense's request for copies of images from 'Highly Confidential' drives due to review burdens.

locations: Denver, CO 80203 (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. office)
New York (NY, referenced regarding hard-drive review location)
keyFacts: The defense claims thousands to hundreds of thousands of photos in discovery are unreadable due to technical problems, impeding their constitutional right to review evidence.

Defense attorney Laura Menninger states that among the 'highly confidential' photos she reviewed, she saw adult nudity but did not see anything that would qualify as child pornography under the statute.
The defense challenges the prosecution's requirement to review adult nudity only in government offices, arguing it imposes an 'extraordinary cost' and impedes their defense preparation.

Technical issues cited include a corrupt Excel spreadsheet (SDNY_GM_00467566), photo files without discernible readers, and an index that fails to match files with Bates stamps or indicate 'highly confidential' status.
Ghislaine Maxwell is attempting to review discovery from her laptop at the Metropolitan Detention Center but is hampered by the load file format and lack of appropriate software.
